meanings.definition: Engaged in a physical struggle or fight
meanings.sent1: The two wrastled boys were covered in dirt after their playful scuffle.
meanings.sent2: The wrastled cat emerged victorious after the intense wrestling match with the dog.
meanings.sent3: The wrastled siblings laughed as they tumbled around in the grass, pretending to fight.
meanings.sent4: The wrastled warriors clashed in the arena, their strength and determination evident to all.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wrastled wrestlers locked in combat was etched in the spectators' minds.

meanings.definition: Struggled or grappled with someone or something
meanings.sent1: He wrastled with the jar lid, trying to open it with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The hiker wrastled with the heavy backpack as he trudged up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: She wrastled with her tangled hair, trying to brush out the knots.
meanings.sent4: The detective wrastled with the complex case, piecing together clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The young boy wrastled with his shoelaces, attempting to tie them into neat bows.
